text: I'm gonna share something with you that
I haven't shared with you before I don't
really know why but it's broken noodles
cooked directly in sauce I have four
cups of homemade tomato sauce in here to
that I've added two cups of water
once your mixture I guess sauce is
boiling you can add your noodles this is
nine ounces or one package of
pappardelle and that's right I'm putting
it right into the sauce stir it in and
then you just cook your pasta the way
you would cook your pasta this
particular pasta since it's like a
cleaner pasta takes about six to eight
minutes to cook and you just cook it
right here in the simmering sauce these
are almost done but I realized I was
supposed to break them apart mostly so
that they would cook more evenly but
also because it's easier to serve that
way so I'm just going to go in with my
scissors and cut them up that's why this
recipe is called broken noodles in
tomato sauce read the recipe but as you
can see the sauce is thickened up that's
because the noodles absorbed all of that
water that's it they're done serve it up
to start to finish dinner's ready in 30
minutes or less even if you're making
your own cloth top with some ricotta
cheese some basil and there you have it
that's all there is to it
cooking your noodles right in this sauce
is a totally good thing have you ever
cooked with soba noodles they're a very
thin buckwheat noodle and they only take
about three minutes to cook which means
they're fantastic for a really quick
dinner you want to drain them and then
rinse them under cold water to remove
the excess starch make sure you let
those get nice and dry because you're
going to dress them in a little dressing
of lime and soy sauce I need two
tablespoons of lime juice that's about
one whole lime depending on how you see
it is nice and tangy two tablespoons of
soy sauce and then a tablespoon of
neutral flavored oil like a safflower
oil if you wanted to throw a little bit
of toasted sesame oil in here that would
be really good
add the soba noodles
toss them around and then mix in some
sliced cucumber I have some toasted
peanuts unsalted give this a little bit
of a chop look at this dinner is almost
ready the last thing I'm going to do is
add about 1/2 a cup of mint leaves great
with seafood glam obviously and here
it's really delicious too and then the
last thing that you need are a couple of
scallions and that dinner's ready
ring the dinner bell bring them in how
beautiful I love it
today's recipe is a chicken soup with
rice noodles I'm starting off by soaking
my rice noodles with a very hot water
this is 6 ounces of rice noodles which
means they're gluten free so peel your
ginger you need about 2 inches cut it
just into slices nice and thin and you
cut across the fibers most people won't
be eating the ginger once the soup is
done but I actually love to eat big
pieces of ginger now I'm using a whole
jalapeno with the seeds because I want
it spicy and then some lime juice you
need about 6 tablespoons total I have
three and a half cups of broth in this
pot to that I'm adding my ginger it
needs to simmer to infuse the broth with
the flavor for about 10 minutes after 10
minutes you can add the rest of your
ingredients 1 can of coconut milk once
your broth returns to a simmer you can
add chicken this is 12 ounces of chicken
that's been thinly sliced because it's
been thinly sliced it shouldn't take
more than about 2 or 3 minutes to cook
through now you can add 3 tablespoons of
fish sauce just a hint light brown sugar
the jalapenos can go in as well the lime
juice and a 1/2 a cup of cilantro by
this point your noodles should be soaked
and softened so you can drain them
and then they can go right into the
broth as well that's it it's done
serve some up ready Ryan fantastic and
just what the doctor ordered spicy salty
sour sweet fantastic
you
